entry.title: How to create business rule to restrict the period for editing the Payment Information?
entry.content:
Hi All,

I would like to create a business rule for Payent information.

Any time a user edits the payment information between the 15th of current month and the 1st of next month an error message should come up that this is not possible.

Thank you for the ideas.

 

Szilvia

entry.title: ECT-254765 - Enhanced Error Validation and Visibility for Termination Rollback Scenarios
entry.content:
Hello All,

As per ECT-254765 - Enhancements in Hire, Rehire, Termination, Global Assignment, and Concurrent Employment, 

There is validation error added for termination (Enhanced Error Validation and Visibility for Termination Rollback Scenarios). Does anyone knows how we can replicate this error? what incorrect data will produce this error?

Many thanks

Lalitha

entry.title: Cannot delete a single Compensation Information row with a loading file
entry.content:
We like to test loading files with a single example first and check what it does.

The loading of the attached file shows the 3 pulsating dots and does not proceed, but also not throwing any error for at least half an hour. If we put over 10 rows into the file, it is processed normally.

Does anyone else have the same problem?

entry.title: Using Joule Studio Custom AI Agents to Query Case Status from ServiceNow
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm exploring a use-case with custom Joule Agents, and wondering if anyone has tried something similar yet with ServiceNow (preferably) or other case systems?

The scenario I'm after: An employee is logged into SuccessFactors and asks Joule something like “What’s the status of my case (ref: xxxxx)?”

The aim is for Joule to retrieve the case details from ServiceNow and return the update directly in the Joule chat, without the employee needing to switch systems (steps listed below).

  1. Use the employee's current SuccessFactors user context
  2. Call ServiceNow to get case/ticket status/details for that employee only
  3. Return the result directly in the Joule chat
  4. Uses the SAP Integration Suite or ServiceNow REST API exposed as a Skill

We already use the ServiceNow IntegrationHub SuccessFactors Spoke, and we maintain a shared user identifier between the systems, so user identity matching is already in place. I’d be interested to know if this can be leveraged alongside the Joule Agent.

Also, which approach would be recommended:

  • Joule → SAP Integration Suite → ServiceNow
  • Joule → ServiceNow REST API directly as a skill

Regards,

Dauied Medhanie

entry.title: Is it possible to have a 'count if' type of column in Story Reporting?
entry.content:
Hi!

I am trying to create a story report where I want to report on number of objectives per employee, but also include employees with 0 objectives. Getting the necessary data in a query was not issue, but I can't figure out how to actually get a measure that states how many objectives each employee has.

Using an aggregated list I have been able to show in a table how many objectives each employee has (shows null for employees with 0), but I can't actually use that value for any calculations or graphs since it's not a measure.

entry.title: Receiving error when updating personal data
entry.content:
Hi,

Our employee self service includes being able to update your legal last name and preferred name. However, after enabling the latest people profile, 2 errors are being received. 

1. Personal Information - You don't have the necessary permission.
2. This value is required - Gender

We have opened edit permission to employees to be able to update their personal data. We don't have Gender open for employees to edit, it's required in manage business config, but this has never been an issue for employees when they update their legal last name and/or preferred name. 

Is anyone else receiving these errors too? 

Thanks,
Annie

entry.content:

entry.title: What is the best practice recommendation for Cost Center FO object association?
entry.content:
Hi team,

What is the best practice recommendation for Cost Center FO object association? Should cost centers be associated with Legal Entity or the lowest level of org unit such as Departments? Please clarify.

Thank you.

entry.title: Add Personnel Number Field to EmployeeTime Object and UI in SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We have an integration set up between SAP HCM and SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central.
The employee master data, including the Personnal Number (PERNR) like a 00005010, is successfully transferred from SAP HCM to Employee Central.

When an employee submits an absence request in the Employee Time (EmployeeTime) section, the form displays the employee’s name, time type, work schedule, and other fields but the Personnel Number is not shown.

We have created a custom field in the EmployeeTime object called cust_userIdDisplay, and we have already added this field to the UI (EmployeeTime form).

 

We would like to get guidelines or best practices on how to properly configure the field details for example, how to derive or display the employee’s Personnel Number (PERNR) from the related user or employee record in Employee Central.

We need the Personnel Number to be displayed in the absence request form for reference purposes.

Could you please advise:

  • how to add the Personnel Number field to the EmployeeTime object; and

  • how to configure the user interface (UI) so that this field is visible when submitting or viewing an absence request?

Any step-by-step guidance or related documentation links would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Hide One-Time payment section for approvers of Manage Pending Hires
entry.content:
Hi team,

Can someone please help with the below -

Hide One-Time payment section for MPH approvers for Rehires. The reason being the approvers should not be able to view the Bonus amounts from previous employment in the manage pending hire screen so can the entire one-time payment section be hidden? The workflow setting for the Approvers is Respect RBP Permission =Yes and there are no permissions granted for this portlet to the approver role.

Thank you for your time.

entry.title: Unable to fetch competencies on PM Form based on custom field
entry.content:
Hi,

Requirement:  We have a requirement to fetch the competencies based on roles (custom field/picklist)

We have followed the KBA mentioned below and implemented the below configuration changes as per the provided guidance:

  1. Creation of “sysMappingDataTypesEditTemplate” template with Role field
    → Manage Business Configuration → Employee Profile → View Template
  2. Role field visibility set to Editable
    → Configure Object Definition → Role & Job Code Mapping → Custom Field (Editable)
  3. Assigned a Job Code to the Role→ Manage Job Profile content → Families & Roles 

However, after these changes, we observed that competencies are not being generated for any Job Codes in the Manage profile Content> Families & roles.
KBA :

https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/implementing-and-managing-job-profile-builder/job-code-association-with-multiple-job-roles?version=2505&q=job+code

Kindly help.

Regards,

Shalini

entry.title: Super admin users do not have access to "Administer Time" for themselves.
entry.content:
Hello,

As a super admin I can see the "Administer Time" link in the time off section of the people profile when I view a users profile. I cannot view this link on my own profile and other super admins have the same issue. We are using the latest people profile and had this link before. How can we get this link to show for ourselves? 

Currently we do not have the "Time Management Links" tile visible on the people profile because it is not necessary for most users.

Thanks!

entry.title: Latest People Profile Configuration
entry.content:
Hello,

We are currently configuring latest people profile and I can't seem to find where is this field coming from - N/A (I would say it's probably Job title or Position title), but is it possible to change what type of information/field is stored here under the employee name?

entry.title: Display Departments in custom field based upon Head of Department position
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
I hope that all of you are doing good.

At Department object, we maintain a custom field called "Head of Department Position".  A position can be Head of Department for single department or multiple departments.

We maintain this field "Head of Department Position" at Position object also. We have a requirement, where a custom field in Position Object should display all departments (concatenated by , or -) for which "Head of Department Position" is same.

For Example: For Dept1, Dept2 and Dept3, HOD is "Head of Department Position".
For Position1, HOD is "Head of Department Position", then custom field in Position1 should display value as Dept1, Dept2, Dept3.

I tried via lookup () function but lookup function always returns single value, so it doesn't work if a position is Head of Department for multiple departments.

Kindly guide me on how to achieve this if Position is being created via Org Chart.

 

Best Regards,

entry.title: Employee returns from LOA during Manager's LOA, manager fields not updated by the next level manager
entry.content:
Hi, 

when employees come back from LOA and their managers are still in LOA, the field "manager" in job info is blank' The next level manager name is removed after the actual return date. How to make sure in this scenario that the field is populated by the next level manager?

thanks in advance for your help!

Sevda

entry.title: Mastering Global Assignments: Setting FTE to Zero in SuccessFactors Employee Central
entry.content:
Mastering Global Assignments: Setting FTE to Zero in SuccessFactors Employee Central

 

The Global Assignment (GA) functionality in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central is crucial for managing international mobility. A common configuration challenge is correctly reflecting the employee’s status and headcount (FTE) in their original, home country while they are away.

This guide outlines the standard best practice for handling an employee moving from a Home Location (e.g., India) to a Host Location (e.g., US), ensuring the Home Job Information accurately shows an FTE of 0 and zero Standard Working Hours.

 

1. Understanding the Global Assignment Framework

 

When an employee starts a Global Assignment, SuccessFactors creates two separate, linked employments:

  1. Home Assignment (India): The original, primary employment record. This record must be updated to a "dormant" status.

  2. Host Assignment (US): The new, secondary employment created for the duration of the GA, where the employee is actively working.

 

Configuration Goal

 

The goal is to ensure that the Home Assignment (India) record is marked as inactive, using an appropriate Event Reason, and has both the FTE and Standard Working Hours explicitly set to 0 from the effective date of the GA.

Conversely, the Host Assignment (US) record will maintain the actual working details (e.g., $1.0$ FTE and $40$ Standard Working Hours).

 

2. Key Event Reasons for GA Management

 

To correctly trigger the status and FTE change, you must identify and use the specific Event Reasons configured for the GA process.

Assignment StatusEventRecommended Event Reason CodeEmployee StatusPurpose
Home (Away)Away on Global AssignmentAGA (Away on Global Assignment)DormantTriggers FTE/Hours to 0 on the Home Record.
Home (Return)Back from Global AssignmentBGA (Back from Global Assignment)ActiveTriggers FTE/Hours back to standard (e.g., $1.0$/$40$ hrs) on the Home Record.

Pro Tip: Confirm these exact codes (e.g., AGA, BGA) by checking the Global Assignment Configuration object in Manage Data or the Event Reason codes in Manage Organization, Pay and Job Structures.

 

3. Implementing the Business Rule for FTE = 0

 

The most efficient way to enforce the zero FTE and hours is by implementing a Business Rule on the Job Information element.

 

Step 3a: Create the Business Rule

 

Create an onSave rule scenario on the Job Information Base Object:

SettingValue/Selection
Rule ScenarioTrigger Changes to HRIS Elements / Job Information
Base ObjectJob Information
Rule NameSet_FTE_Zero_For_GA_Home

 

Rule Logic (Pseudo-Code)

 

IF
  Job Information.Event Reason IS EQUAL TO <AGA Code> (Away on Global Assignment)
THEN
  Set Job Information.FTE TO 0
  Set Job Information.Standard Working Hours TO 0
ELSE IF
  Job Information.Event Reason IS EQUAL TO <BGA Code> (Back from Global Assignment)
THEN
  Set Job Information.FTE TO 1.0 (or standard home FTE)
  Set Job Information.Standard Working Hours TO 40 (or standard home hours)

 

Step 3b: Assign the Business Rule

 

The rule must be assigned to the Job Information element to execute when the system records the GA event.

  1. Navigate to Manage Business Configuration (BCUI).

  2. Select the jobInfo HRIS element.

  3. Assign your rule (Set_FTE_Zero_For_GA_Home) as an onSave rule.

 

Summary of the Global Assignment Flow

 

EventRecord AffectedEvent ReasonRule ActionResult
Start GAHome (India)AGARule TriggersFTE & Hours set to 0
Start GAHost (US)ADD GAN/AActive FTE & Hours set
End GAHome (India)BGARule TriggersFTE & Hours set back to Standard
End GAHost (US)End GAN/AEmployment record terminated

By setting up this configuration, you ensure accurate headcount reporting: the FTE moves entirely from the Home entity to the Host entity for the duration of the global assignment, maintaining data integrity across the organization.

entry.title: SuccessFactors Sales Performance Module
entry.content:
Driving Revenue Excellence with SAP Sales Performance Management

In today’s competitive landscape, organizations are increasingly relying on intelligent tools to optimize sales performance and align sales teams with business objectives. The SAP Sales Performance Management (SPM) module empowers companies to design, manage, and analyze their sales strategies with precision.

1. What is SAP SPM?
SAP SPM is an integrated solution that automates and streamlines key processes such as sales incentive management, territory and quota planning, and performance analytics. By eliminating manual processes and data silos, it ensures that sales teams stay motivated and aligned with company goals.

2. Core Capabilities:

  • Incentive Compensation Management: Automate commission calculations, ensure transparency, and reduce payment disputes.

  • Territory and Quota Planning: Optimize sales coverage and set achievable, data-driven quotas.

  • Analytics and Insights: Monitor performance in real time with dashboards that drive accountability and improvement.

3. Business Impact:
Organizations using SAP SPM report improved sales productivity, higher motivation, and faster decision-making. Integrating the module with SAP SuccessFactors or SAP CX solutions further enhances end-to-end visibility — from people performance to customer success.

4. The Future of Sales Enablement:
With built-in AI and predictive analytics, SAP SPM is evolving beyond automation to provide foresight — helping leaders forecast trends, identify performance gaps, and model the impact of incentive plan changes before implementation.

In summary, SAP Sales Performance Management transforms sales operations into a data-driven, transparent, and motivating ecosystem — driving both top-line growth and team engagement.
